intro: Evodiella velutina, commonly known as the velvetleaf betony, is a flowering plant belonging to the Lamiaceae family. It is characterized by its opposite, ovate to lanceolate leaves that are often covered in a fine, velvety pubescence. The plant produces small, tubular flowers that are typically violet or purple in color, arranged in dense clusters at the ends of the stems. It is native to regions of Europe and Asia and is often found in moist, shaded habitats such as woodlands and stream banks. Evodiella velutina is noted for its aromatic properties and has been used in traditional herbal medicine.
